result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin H Olson

defendant.name: Olson, Justin H
defendant.address: 537 State Farm Rd, Lot 26, Deerfield, WI 53531

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CM219, 22CF16, 22CF103, 22CF349 called at 1:37pm
Defendant Justin H Olson in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Justin H Olson.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 
Atty Huebner indicates that a comprehensive offer has been extended by the State this morning; requests an adjournment. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF349: 
Mr. Olson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 1:45pm  

NEXT:  Status Conference on 11/17/22 at 9:00am
Waiver of Prelim on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ml] Cases 21CM219, 22CF16, 22CF102, and 22CF349 called at 10:51AM
Defendant Justin H Olson appeared by video.  Attorney Karl E Huebner appeared by video. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Att Huebner requests that another Status Conference be scheduled, stating that the Defendant has been screened, and approved, for treatment court. ADA Parson advises that she will complete the State's treatment court offer next week and disburse it to the Defense.

The Court sets this matter over for an anticipated Waiver of Preliminary and a Plea and Sentencing Hearing, with an expected treatment court disposition.

recess 10:54AM

NEXT: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Plea and Sentencing on 10/25 at 1:30PM
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ae] case called 10:28 AM Defendant Justin H Olson in court. ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 10:35 am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference with Defendants other cases on 9/30/22 at 11:00 am
NOTE: Copy of complaint sent to Justin at the Jefferson Co. Jail on 09/13/2022. (NMS)
